file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-12-01-04 - WINDSHIELD CENTER POST - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WINDSHIELD CENTER POST - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Windshield Center Post. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 53-12-01-000-801-A WINDSHIELD CENTER POST - REMOVAL WINDSHIELD CENTER POST - INSTALLA- ALL 53-12-01-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 53-12-01 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-12-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. WINDSHIELD CENTER POST - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Windshield Center Post. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 34-25-01-000-801-A/400 STANDBY MAGNETIC COMPASS - REMOVAL AMM TASK 56-10-01-000-801-A/400 COCKPIT WINDSHIELD - REMOVAL AMM TASK 56-10-01-000-802-A/400 COCKPIT WINDSHIELD - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit partition LH 224 Cockpit partition RH D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the forward fuselage I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-12-01 Page 2 of 7 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Remove the standby magnetic compass ( AMM TASK 34-25-01-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove the cockpit windshield ( AMM TASK 56-10-01-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 56-10-01-000-802-A/400, as applicable). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the cotter pin (9), nut (10), washer (11), bolt (2), and washer (1). (2) Remove the cotter pin (7), nut (6), washer (5), bolt (3), and washer (4). (3) Remove the windshield center post (8). (4) Remove the bushing (12), if necessary. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-12-01 Page 3 of 7 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Windshield Center Post - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 223 224 11. WASHER 1 10. NUT 9. COTTER PIN 1. WASHER 8. WINDSHIELD CENTER POST B 7. COTTER PIN 2. BOLT 1 6. NUT B 4. WASHER 5. WASHER 3. BOLT DET. A 12. BUSHING VIEW B 1 TORQUE: 11.3 - 13.6 N.m (100 - 120 lb.in) PLUS DRAG TORQUE: 1.6 - 11.3 N.m (14 - 100 lb.in). EM145AMM530498A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-12-01 Page 4 of 7 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-12-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. WINDSHIELD CENTER POST - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Windshield Center Post. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 34-25-01-400-801-A/400 STANDBY MAGNETIC COMPASS - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 56-10-01-400-801-A/400 COCKPIT WINDSHIELD - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 56-10-01-400-802-A/400 COCKPIT WINDSHIELD - INSTALLATION IPC 53-12-00 FORWARD II C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit partition LH 224 Cockpit partition RH D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area available Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the bolts available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - MEK AR MIL-PRF-81352 Acrylic Nitrocellulose Gloss Lacquer AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-12-01 Page 5 of 7 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Forward II IPC 53-12-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the forward fuselage I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (1) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the parts. (2) Install the bushing (12), if necessary. (3) Position the windshield center post (8). (4) Install the washer (1), bolt (2), and washer (11). (a) Turn the nut (10) and measure the drag torque with a torque wrench. (b) Make sure that the drag torque measured is between 1.6 - 11.3 N.m (14 - 100 lb.in). (c) Add the measured drag torque value to the standard torque of 11.3 - 13.6 N.m (100 - 120 lb.in) to get the final torque. (d) Use a torque wrench to apply the final torque to the nut (10). (5) Install the washer (4), bolt (3), and washer (5). (a) Turn the nut (6) and measure the drag torque with a torque wrench. (b) Make sure that the drag torque measured is between 1.6 - 11.3 N.m (14 - 100 lb.in). (c) Add the measured drag torque value to the standard torque of 11.3 - 13.6 N.m (100 - 120 lb.in) to get the final torque. (d) Use a torque wrench to apply the final torque to the nut (6). (6) Install the cotter pins (9) and (7). (7) Mark the nuts (10) and (6) in their tightened position with red nitrocellulose acrylic lacquer paint. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-12-01 Page 6 of 7 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the cockpit windshield ( AMM TASK 56-10-01-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 56-10-01-400-802-A/400, as applicable). (2) Install the standby magnetic compass ( AMM TASK 34-25-01-400-801-A/400). (3) Put the aircraft back to its initial condition. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-12-01 Page 7 of 7 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
